SEARCH
Package org.efs.activator

Interface IEfsActivateAgent

All Superinterfaces:
IEfsAgent
public interface IEfsActivateAgent extends IEfsAgent
Extends IEfsAgent with methods supporting activation. These methods are: startup, activate, deactivate, and stop. EFS agents named in WorkflowSteps must implement IEfsActivateAgent and be registered with its dispatcher before any activator executions may be performed.
Author:
Charles W. Rapp

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    activate()
    This method transitions an agent from stand-by to active.
    void
    deactivate()
    This method transitions an agent from active to stand-by.
    void
    startup()
    This method transitions an agent from stopped to stand-by.
    void
    stop()
    This method transitions an agent from EfsAgentState.STAND_BY to EfsAgentState.STOPPED.

    Methods inherited from interface org.efs.dispatcher.IEfsAgent

    name

  • Method Details

    • startup

      void startup()
      This method transitions an agent from stopped to stand-by. This transition is considered successful if the method returns normally. Any exception thrown by this method is interpreted as a failure and the agent remains in the stop state.

    • activate

      void activate()
      This method transitions an agent from stand-by to active. This transition is considered successful if the method returns normally. Any exception thrown by this method is interpreted as a failure and the agent remains in the stand-by state.

    • deactivate

      void deactivate()
      This method transitions an agent from active to stand-by. This transition is considered successful if the the method returns normally. Any exception thrown by this method is interpreted as a failure and the agent remains in the active state.

    • stop

      void stop()
      This method transitions an agent from EfsAgentState.STAND_BY to EfsAgentState.STOPPED. This transition is considered successful if the the method returns normally. Any exception thrown by this method is interpreted as a failure and the agent remains in the stand-by state.
